mm.controller.modeling

Class XmlParser

extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • XmlParser

        public XmlParser()
        Constructor, creates a new instance of DocumentBuilderFactory and DocuemtnBuilder. Changes the Namespace- and XIncludeawareness to true.
        Throws:
        javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException - if the documentBuilder can not be instantiated.

    • Method Detail

      • parseXml

        public boolean parseXml(java.lang.String file)
        Parses the committed file. The method uses the DocumentBuilder.parse(File f) method to save the parsed file in a DOM Tree (http://www.w3.org/DOM/) structure. Variable doc contains the root of the DOM Tree.
        Parameters:
        file - contains a String which locates the XML file to be parsed
        Returns:
        true if the file was parsed, else false
        Throws:
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - or IOException if the committed file can not be found.

      • parseAndSaveXml

        public boolean parseAndSaveXml(java.lang.String read,
                               java.io.File save)
                        throws javax.xml.transform.TransformerConfigurationException
        Parses the given File at directory read and saves the DOM as XML. Uses the classes TransformerFactory and Transformer to build a XML form DOM.
        Parameters:
        read - contains a String which locates the XML file to be parsed
        save - contains a File where the XML should be saved
        Returns:
        true, if the file is parsed and saved. Else false
        Throws:
        javax.xml.transform.TransformerConfigurationException - if the transformer Object can not be generated
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - or IOException if the committed file can not be found
        javax.xml.transform.TransformerException - if the XML file can not be saved

      • getNodeObjects

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,NodeObjects> getNodeObjects()
        Uses DOM Tree out of Variable doc to build Objects for every Node in Tree. Builds a new Object every time when identifier "ID" occurs. Objects are from type NodeObjects and include information for every node. Method uses a node list, which contains every node of the DOM Tree. Nodes will be checked for their name and stored in the respective Variable in an Object.
        Returns:
        HashMap, includes NodeID as Key and NodeObjects with all the Information.

      • getVmObjects

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,VmObjects> getVmObjects()
        Same as getNodeObjects, just saves VMs. This method just saves VM (virtual machine) objects instead of node Objects. The method uses the same equal pattern.
        Returns:
        HashMap, includes VmID as key and VmObjects with all the information

      • getDomString

        public java.lang.String getDomString()
                              throws javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
        Builds a String of the DOM Tree. The returned String is formed like a XML File
        Returns:
        String, formed like a XML File
        Throws:
        javax.xml.transform.TransformerException - if the Transformer can not be created

      • getJsonString

        public JSONObject getJsonString(java.lang.String path)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates a JSON object from a XML file. Template of this method by https://github.com/douglascrockford/JSON-java. All methods including JSONObject are related to http://www.json.org/java/index.html.
        Parameters:
        path - File path to a xml file. File should be converted into a JSON object.
        Returns:
        JSONObject for the xml file at path file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - more specific IOException, FileNotFoundException, JSONException
